title: GMB viewers blast 'weirdo' reality star Luisa Zissman for photoshopping her children
text:
Viewers have blasted reality star Luisa Zissman after she told Good Morning Britain that she photoshops pictures of her children.

She insisted that she'd never remove a permanent feature such as scarring or freckles from a photo, but said she does remove blemishes so that the pictures look nicer when displayed in her house.

People took to social media to slam her comments as they demanded: 'Let kids be kids!'

But she told Suzanna Reid and Adil Ray on the programme that it was fun to give her daughters 'a little ego boost'.

Zissman (pictured, right, on today's Good Morning Britain) told the show that she photoshops pictures of her children

'We've had photo shoots family ones done and I've just smoothed them over,' she said.

'Two of them are ginger so they have that really fair skin that goes all blotchy and I think its nice to look a bit smoother.

'They think they're beautiful whatever, but when they'er on the wall i want them to look nice - I have a very nice house.'

But she said that she thinks it's wrong to put filters on children on social media to make their eyes bigger or make them appear thinner.

Luisa also said that she would never remove a permanent feature because she never wants her children to be ashamed.

The reality star insisted that 'sometimes it's okay not to like things about yourself', leading to fury on Twitter.

An account using the name Eden wrote: 'Weirdo. Let kids be kids ffs.' And another fumed: 'FFS! What a Princess Perfect! Disgusting!'
description: Luisa Zissman infuriated Good Morning Britain viewers but insisted she would never want her children to be ashamed of permanent blemishes and hates people putting their children on social media.
